From: "Jeff Miller" <jemiller@...>
Subject: Matlab RAM problem for Equilibrate
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=211891685; y=QDjHKpwc8r1hoLEVvTlK1iYWTZphxPxUopAHlpg_W-2A_8J1mw
X-Yahoo-Profile: csmnofbobs

Dr. Goodwin,
I realized how to get around the problem that using "clear all" 
and "cleanup" deletes all of the loop variables, as well as the data
I 
want to store- at the end of each loop I record all important 
variables in csv files, and then call the values I need for the next 
run through the loop.  So, I am now able to use the "clear all" and 
the "cleanup" commands either at the end of each loop, or right
before 
equilibrate.  However, this did not improve the memory problem at 
all!  With all variables and C++ Cantera objects deleted, shouldn't 
equilibrate run just as if it were by its self, and not in a 
complicated loop?  After about 5-10 temperature increments, 
equilibrate still crashes Matlab, and I have to exit and restart the 
program in order to do anything.  Do you have any suggestions?  How 
much better is Python at memory management?  Would it be worth 
switching to Python? 
Thank you very much for any help you can offer.
Jeff Miller
